title: Bill C-11: Why is YouTube mad at Canada?
description: A law that seeks to give Canadian artists a boost online has led to some accusations of censorship.

title: Why there is serious money in kitchen fumes
description: Restaurants are extracting energy from their kitchen fumes and using it to heat the whole business.

title: Leicester City 2-2 Everton: Chaotic match leaves both in deep trouble
description: Leicester City and Everton have to settle for a draw in a chaotic match which leaves both in deep trouble at the wrong end of the Premier League table.

title: King Charles Coronation: What will he wear for the ceremony?
description: The King will wear layers of glittering garments, some of which were created for George V.

title: Ukraine war: More than 20,000 Russian fighters dead in Bakhmut, US says
description: Russia has suffered more than 100,000 causalities in the battle for Bakhmut, the White House says.

title: France protests: More than 100 police hurt in May Day demonstrations
description: Almost 300 people are arrested across France in clashes with demonstrators angry at pension reforms.

title: Blackburn Rovers 1-1 Luton Town: Hayden Carter rescues point against Hatters
description: Hayden Carter's goal rescues a point for Blackburn against Luton and keeps their faint Championship play-off hopes alive.

title: Japan street piano confiscated as public 'break rules'
description: Authorities in a Japanese city decided too many people were displaying poor manners while playing it.

title: Azerbaijan Grand Prix: Toto Wolff warning after 'boring' Baku race
description: Mercedes team principal Toto Wolff says the Azerbaijan Grand Prix was "boring" and Formula 1 needs look at what to do about it.

title: Stranded in Sudan with passports locked in Western embassies
description: Sudanese citizens say they can't escape because their passports are inside closed European embassies.

title: World Snooker Championship 2023 final: Luca Brecel extends lead over Mark Selby
description: Luca Brecel produces an incredible display of potting to open up a 15-10 lead over Mark Selby and move within three frames of a first world title.

title: Missing teenager: Body found in the River Thames
description: Rescuers recover a body in a search for a boy of 17 who went missing in a river in Gloucestershire.

title: TV host admonishes man gluing himself to podium
description: Host Jeremy Seydoux is surprised when a climate activist interrupts a local election debate.

title: Aerosmith: US rock band announce farewell tour
description: Steven Tyler and co will say "peace out" to North America from later this year.

title: Sudan crisis: Fighter jets are roaring over my home in Omdurman
description: Thousands of people have left Sudan's capital but the situation is getting worse for those left behind.

title: Trump mistrial request denied in E Jean Carroll rape lawsuit
description: Donald Trump's legal team had argued "pervasive unfair" rulings had been made in the civil trial.

title: La Vuelta Femenina: Henderson takes first red jersey as Jumbo-Visma win opening stage
description: British rider Anna Henderson will take the La Vuelta Femenina's red jersey into day two after Team Jumbo-Visma win stage one in Torrevieja.

title: World Snooker Championship final 2023: Mark Selby's 147 break in 147 seconds
description: Watch Mark Selby's "stunning" 147 break in 147 seconds as the four-time world champion becomes the first player to make a maximum break in a World Championship final.

title: Rotherham beat Boro to secure Championship safety
description: Rotherham secure Championship safety as Hakeem Odoffin's goal helps them beat 10-man Middlesbrough.

title: Rugby World Cup 2023: Centre Joe Hawkins left out of Wales squad with 10 uncapped players named
description: Centre Joe Hawkins is left out of Wales' World Cup training squad which includes former England prop Henry Thomas.

title: Watch: Florida tornado flips car across highway
description: A driver captured video of a car being flipped upside down by a powerful storm in Florida.

title: Texas shooting: Father tells how gunman opened fire on his family home
description: "It's like we're alive but at the same time we're not," said the man, whose wife and son were killed.

title: Powerful tornado flips cars in south Florida
description: South Florida and Virginia Beach are cleaning up after both regions were hit by weekend tornadoes.

title: MP Stella Creasy investigated after troll contacted social services
description: Labour MP Stella Creasy was investigated after a troll told authorities her children were at risk.

title: Stone blocks collapse onto road from bank building in Thurso
description: The centre of Thurso has been cordoned off after the incident in the early hours of Monday.

title: Tributes paid to man stabbed near Bodmin nightclub
description: Five other people have since been released from hospital, with two recovering from surgery.

title: World Judo Championships: Ukrainian athletes to boycott over Russian participation concerns
description: Ukraine will boycott the World Judo Championships after it was decided athletes from Russia and Belarus would be allowed to compete as neutrals.

title: Arsenal: Mikel Arteta says 'nicest part' of Premier League season to come
description: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta says the Premier League title race is "not over" before Tuesday's meeting with Chelsea.

title: Donald Trump arrives in Scotland on golf course visit
description: The former US president has flown into Aberdeen on his first visit to the UK since 2019.

title: Watch: Man does worm at Rita Ora show, she loves it
description: Ian Smith busted out the moves as Rita Ora sang at the Prince's Trust event in New York.

title: Explosion in Russian border region derails freight train - governor
description: The region - which borders Ukraine and Belarus - has seen various acts of sabotage.

title: NFL Draft 2023: Winners and losers as Houston Texans shine and Will Levis suffers
description: The Houston Texans make a big splash and highly rated quarterback Will Levis slides down the order.

title: King Charles Coronation: George VI's chair recycled for enthronement
description: King Charles will be reusing a chair used by his grandfather George VI, in a bid for sustainability.

title: Sadia Kabeya column: There were a lot of nerves for Grand Slam decider
description: England flanker Sadia Kabeya discusses a historic Grand Slam win, nerves and an exciting future ahead.

title: Maurizio Cattelan: Banana artwork eaten by Seoul museum visitor
description: A university student told staff he ate the fruit on display because he was hungry.

title: Shaquil Barrett's daughter, aged two, drowns in pool at Florida home
description: The youngest child of linebacker Shaquil Barrett fell into the family's Florida pool, said police.

title: First Republic: JP Morgan to take over major US bank
description: First Republic was seized by regulators, the third major US bank to fail in recent months.

title: Ding Liren becomes China's first male world chess champion
description: Ding Liren, 30, defeated his higher-ranked Russian opponent in a rapid tiebreaker game.

title: Ukraine war: Russia launches second pre-dawn missile attack in three days
description: One person dies and dozens more are injured in Russia's second pre-dawn attack in three days.

title: Trevelyan descendant 'would consider' Irish famine compensation
description: An ex-BBC journalist says her ancestor, referenced in the Fields of Athenry, "failed" Irish people.

title: Capita: Watchdog warns pension funds over data after hack
description: The Pensions Regulator has told hundreds of funds to check details of customers after a data leak.

title: Aberystwyth uni told student was suicidal before his death
description: Charlie McLeod's mum Emma Laney says she feels "a lot more should have been done" to help him.

title: Cardiff: Disabled people's 20-year railway station access fight
description: One of Wales' busiest railway stations has no lift and steep stairs between platforms.

title: UK chip giant Arm files for blockbuster US share listing
description: In a blow to the London stock market, the firm said in March that it would not list shares in the UK.

title: Everton: Toxic civil war between fans and board ripping Toffees apart
description: BBC Sport looks at the toxic civil war that has erupted between Everton and disgruntled supporters and whether the doom and gloom can make way for green shoots of recovery.

title: Jock Zonfrillo: MasterChef Australia host dies suddenly, aged 46
description: The Scottish-born chef and presenter died suddenly, aged 46, on Sunday.

title: The Papers: Cancer nurses strike, and £19bn unclaimed benefits
description: Monday's front pages carry a mix of stories, including the 28-hour nurses strike in England.

title: The people turning time into a currency
description: So-called "time-banking" schemes are letting people get paid in time credits for the work they do.

title: Printworks: Final show for famous dance music venue
description: The London club, which has hosted the Chemical Brothers and Aphex Twin, will become an office block.

title: Local elections 2023: Young councillors 'need seat at table'
description: From low pay to juggling meetings - what's it like to be a young councillor in England?

title: The place where property prices are set by what locals earn
description: A housing project in south London is selling flats with prices set according to local income levels.
